rev.comment: /* Filming */ we cannot determine the budgets for many films, and comparing it to others based on Wiki info isn't good. X3 is listed as 210 in places, with Pirates 2 listed as 200m+ in some also
/* Filming */ Sentence was a bit confusing. Well, it confused me, anyways.
Revert; does not need a tag unless this becomes a dispute. Initiate the discussion on the talk page; we have a budget expert in-house. Bigs?
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 128357939 by [[Special:Contributions/Art1991|Art1991]] ([[User talk:Art1991|talk]]) ok people, PLEASE read [[WP:AVTRIV]]
Don't need specific numbers for each country's opening day; it's being released in 106 countries, listing all opening day information outside the production's country's opening day is indiscriminate
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 128350535 by [[Special:Contributions/Nodekeeper|Nodekeeper]] ([[User talk:Nodekeeper|talk]]) read the whole statement, you can't "has becomes"
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 128349002 by [[Special:Contributions/Ameratsu|Ameratsu]] ([[User talk:Ameratsu|talk]]) film American, so we use "toward" and read [[WP:AVTRIV]] and [[WP:NOR]]
"toward" = more often in American english; "towards" = more often in British english
avoid trivia sections, especially original research that compares different mediums of a character to this one
re-added trivia as it doesn't do anything but give more information about the movie.

/* Development */ a lot. New casting section for one
/* Critical reaction */ Applied template to other citation
/* Critical reaction */ Applied template to one review's citation, will do the other in a sec
/* Plot */ it's a metoerITE, and we don't use "beknownST" in American english
/* Critical reaction */ and a review by CNN
/* Sequels */ Not news in terms of Raimi returning to direct
/* Critical reaction */ added link to MSNBC
/* Plot */ black suit use twice in back to back sentences; explaining they look alike, they never say Venom, so that would be incorrect on our part to use that name, but we need to explain

/* Critical reaction */ update...we don't use user ratings
/* Plot */ If you question what is shown on-screen every time, this plot section would be a very awkward read.

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 128163352 by [[Special:Contributions/DrZaius1|DrZaius1]] ([[User talk:DrZaius1|talk]]) there is no "seemingly" there isn't anything left
/* Plot */ fixing sentence. He never calls himself Venom, and the only time you see "Venom" is in the credits, like "New Goblin". for the purpose of the plot, just use the name used in the film
/* Plot */ don't need a second warning
/* Plot */ cleaning up and trimming the plot; never called himself or was referred to as "New Goblin" that is just a credits thing; also have to reorder (someone messed the order of events up)
/* Plot */ removing redundant links and names (we have a cast section people), it's a meteorite when it lands, it's a meteor when it enters the atmosphere
corrected. Young is the only listed composer for this film
Rem. "and Canada" because other countries are getting theirs that date, too; it's undue weight. The U.S. release date is significant because that's the home of production
changed future tense writing in introductary paragraph to past tense.
Revert; you've been linkspamming, I've noticed...
you should really read the article, that info is already there
Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/KISSBATMAN1|KISSBATMAN1]] ([[User talk:KISSBATMAN1|talk]]) to last revision (128062871) by Erik using [[WP:VPRF|VP]]
/* Critical reaction */ Updated Metacritic and accessdate attribute
/* Critical reaction */ Updated rotten tomatoes averages
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes
trump what about the first two films?
/* Writing */ "In Good Company" got producers interested in Grace
/* Plot */ fake plot i've watched it it's not there
Removed linkspam, and guess what, I'm going to hunt the rest of your filmdetail.com URLs and remove them, too
Revert redundant information; look under Release, and it's actually all of North America
/* Release */ Re-organized to mention 53 IMAX theaters in the batch
What was the point of removing all that?
/* Critical reaction */ Metacritic included, properly cited and all
/* Critical reaction */ MetaCritic is different, don't insert it in the middle of a Rotten Tomatoes rating, and bring along a source with it
looks the same, but without the redirect
/* Marketing */ Past tense and present tense
/* Box office performance */ +international, to be more descriptive
Going with what was suggested on the talk page, since "screenplay" should cover both "story" and "script" stages in the absence of a "story" label
/* Release */ Re-sorted paragraphs to be chronological in terms of release info... not sure if I should combine the first two paragraphs?
Revert uncited change to info about writers
/* Release */ Corrected mistake, 800~ locations was for one territory
/* Box office performance */ Resorted information so the paragraph is better structured
/* Box office performance */ it => the film
/* Box office performance */ Hold on, will add ref in a minute
/* Critical reaction */ Updated RT rating, 'cause if I don't, someone else will
/* Box office performance */ Rem. stray punctuation
/* Plot */ Too many Parkers to just say "Parker".
Revert edit that is presently undergoing discussion
/* Critical reaction */ Moved label to front
Assume good faith... I found the URL for the review. Feel free to clean it up, though. I don't think the last scene needs to be referenced, though.
Revert, international poster serves better since the film is taking an international angle
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 127706848 by [[Special:Contributions/ConsoleZ|ConsoleZ]] ([[User talk:ConsoleZ|talk]]) no need to change the poster to an older one; international is less bias to the US
/* Release */ RT rating... 47 reviews, that should be reasonable enough to include RT now
/* Box office performance */ +"on the same day" to reflect that Italy opened on May 1 like the Asian territories
/* Box office performance */ Italian box office record
/* Box office performance */ Added date to set timeline
/* Plot */ keeping my eyes crossed while I type this so I don't read the plot...anyway there are policies about the length, so lets watch the wording guys
/* Release */ Merged paragraphs, removed advance review... we'll be getting a lot soon enough, and this one wasn't too special
/* Release */ Performance in Asian territories... could Spidey sink the Titanic in time?!
/* Synopsis */ changed "Synopsis" to "Plot" to match the articles on Spiderman 1 and 2, reworded the plot, added wikilinks
/* External links */ link to FilmSpot movie page w/ trailers, behind the scenes footage, etc
"In "Spider-Man 3," based on the legendary Marvel Comics series, ..." is copyvio (a Google search returns pages of hits with the exact same wording for the entire paragraph)
decided to move sequels to [[Spider-Man film series]]

/* Release */ Another switch to past tense... recentism sucks
/* Release */ Past tense for May 1 reeleases
I'm sure it's true, but it's not in the citation
The previous revision was better, though the "to" correction in the embedded comment is fine
not part of the official synopsis release by Sony, since the movie isn't out yet we aren't adding anything we "know" from trailers and other readings
Revert vandalism that was marked as "minor"... even worse
Removed redundant detail... you know, you can read the article to see if the information exists, then add it

Image overload; poster already shows this, plus image cannot below directly under a section title, and the caption for the image did not make sense. More images can be used when the film comes out
/* Writing */ added another image to the article
Revert unnecessary changes; wiki-links show the articles for the companies, not their home pages -- and removed a fan site that somehow got on the list
/* External links */ fixed flaws in external links
Revert, you can't give a specific number and then add a plus to it
Rem. image that does not meet fair use rationale; context is not in-depth enough to warrant an image
/* Writing */ his = Harry's, to be clear
/* Cast and characters */ Rem. secondary characters
/* Filming */ Changed into two sentences and fixed tense
/* Writing */ Is there a reason this was removed?
/* Effects */ Actually, let's just merge these two... and some re-wording
/* Release */ Removed sentence that does not match citation
Revert, when you removed "groundbreaking", you killed the purpose of the sentence. The programs were newly designed for the film itself, and not ever used before
/* Release */ "...including Bahrein"? How is that important...
/* Effects */ actually, that whole sentence serves no purpose; if they made the programs for the film, it's safe to say they used them
/* Cast and characters */ But, but... I thought he was Mysterio!
